page.title: 13Private Transport
page.content: Most households now have cars. The lack of public transport means that anyone who has any distance to travel to work needs a car. More and more households have two cars, one for the breadwinner to travel to work and one for taking children to playschool, primary school, shopping in town, attending dental or doctors appointments etc. The current pace of life means that fewer people are prepared to wait for public transport and they find it difficult to arrange appointments to fit in with bus timetables. The number of children travelling around the villages on bicycles is diminishing, most parents not considering it safe to allow their children out in the evenings on their own. This means parents have to take their children to, e.g. Youth Club.
